result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Cormier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Balance of sentence to commence forthwith.
Concurrent with: 90 Day Contempt Sentence currently being served as to Waushara Co Case No.  2013PA000016.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. Cormier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:25 AM: Defendant Robert A. Cormier in court, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is no longer eligible for SPD services due to his release.  Per Defendant:  Currently serving a 90 day hold sentence for a child support matter.  Is willing to accept State's offer with concurrent terms on serving.  Court advises Def that the Judge cannot negotiate terms of resolution.  Offer recited by DA.  Def concurs with State's recital.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Knowing and voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 (Obst):  NC  Plea Ct 2 (No DL 2):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Ct 1: Concurrent SEH imposed of 60 days - concurrent to Contempt SEH currently being served - SEH to begin forthwith; 5 days TS credit, Huber and GT; Court Costs Both Counts - 60 DTP or PP plus DNA Sample to be provided by the end of the day today at WCJ and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Robert Cormier & Attorney Szilagyi appear by video

1:21 pm case called. Defendant Robert A. Cormier in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader regarding overview of case. Bond argument by DA Blader. Bond argument by Attorney Szilagyi.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Case called @ 3:33 p.m. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin. 16TR951 - Dismissed outright. 16TR952 & 16TR953: Default Judgment entered. Court orders the bond amounts noted on the citations w/ 60 DTP or PP.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Case called @ 3:11 p.m. Defendant Robert A. Cormier in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi is requesting another date for plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and schedued as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on May 11, 2016 at 03:55 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:10 p.m. Defendant Robert A. Cormier in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi takes no position as to bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 03:55 pm.
